remarks: Epsilon induction for sets contained in a transitive set.  If we are allowed to assume Infinity, then all sets have a transitive closure and this reduces to ~ setind ; however, this version is useful without Infinity.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Oct-2014.)
statement:
setindtr $p |- ( A. x ( x C_ A -> x e. A ) -> ( E. y ( Tr y /\ B e. y ) -> B e. A ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
